void.string: Some of Australias top climate change specialists with expertise covering fields such as international climate policy, meteorology, oceanography, environment, sustainability and risk management deliver an up to date assessment of the current and future climate warnings confronting the planet. Panellists include 2009 Copenhagen Conference attendees Ian Fry, UN spokesperson for the Alliance of Small Island States, and Jenny Goldie from Sustainable Population Australia, who will review the outcomes of the negotiations.The forum was held as a part of the Australian Meteorological and Oceanographic Society (AMOS) 17th National Conference 27-29 January 2010 at The Australian National University.Speakers include:Professor David Karoly (Chair), Professor of Meteorology, University of MelbourneProfessor Matthew England, Professor of Oceanography, University of NSWDr Maxine Cooper, ACT Commissioner for Sustainability and EnvironmentDr John Schneider, Head, Risk and Impact Analysis Group, Geoscience AustraliaIan Fry, UN spokesperson for the Alliance of Small Island States on matter relating to land use, land use change and forestry, including climate changeJenny Goldie, National Secretary of Sustainable Population AustraliaThis forum is part of the TOYOTA-ANU Public Lecture Series. viewcount:0 Time:null

Some of Australias top climate change specialists with expertise covering fields such as international climate policy, meteorology, oceanography, environment, sustainability and risk management deliver an up to date assessment of the current and future climate warnings confronting the planet. Panellists include 2009 Copenhagen Conference attendees Ian Fry, UN spokesperson for the Alliance of Small Island States, and Jenny Goldie from Sustainable Population Australia, who will review the outcomes of the negotiations.The forum was held as a part of the Australian Meteorological and Oceanographic Society (AMOS) 17th National Conference 27-29 January 2010 at The Australian National University.Speakers include:Professor David Karoly (Chair), Professor of Meteorology, University of MelbourneProfessor Matthew England, Professor of Oceanography, University of NSWDr Maxine Cooper, ACT Commissioner for Sustainability and EnvironmentDr John Schneider, Head, Risk and Impact Analysis Group, Geoscience AustraliaIan Fry, UN spokesperson for the Alliance of Small Island States on matter relating to land use, land use change and forestry, including climate changeJenny Goldie, National Secretary of Sustainable Population AustraliaThis forum is part of the TOYOTA-ANU Public Lecture Series.
Climate Change: Ask an expert - public lecture Jan 2010
